title: Blended e-learning course for evidence-based medical practice competencies: Strengthening scientific inquiry skills

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational clinical medicine knowledge, basic research methodology concepts, and ability to design scientific experiments and interpret data
context.additional_context: A customized course for healthcare professionals primarily using smartphones, combining real-time sessions with mobile-optimized learning materials. Learners practice formulating hypotheses and evidence-based decision-making based on observable clinical data.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five-step Evidence-Based Medicine (EBM) process—formulating questions, literature search, critical appraisal, application, and evaluation—with 80% accuracy according to scientific inquiry procedures.
Learners can construct research questions using the PICO framework (Patient/Population, Intervention, Comparison, Outcome) based on real clinical scenarios and clearly distinguish variables.

Learners pass formative assessments with over 75% accuracy by critically analyzing research papers (e.g., evaluating measurement validity, evidence levels) on smartphone-based platforms to determine practical applicability.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
